messages.content:
You are an expert software engineer specialized in bug localization. 
Your task is to identify the files most likely to contain bugs based on bug descriptions. 
You have access to several tools to help you in this task. 
From the files you have seen, you will select 10 files that you believe are most likely to contain the bug.

<bug_description>
Imports must be resolved before mocking in Microcks When trying to mock an API (that contains imported types) with microcks, the following errors occurs in the browser:

> io.apicurio.hub.core.exceptions.ServerError: Unexpected server error
>	at io.apicurio.hub.api.rest.impl.DesignsResource.mockApi(DesignsResource.java:933)
> […]
> Caused by: io.apicurio.hub.api.microcks.MicrocksConnectorException: InternalServerError returned by Microcks server
>	at io.apicurio.hub.api.microcks.MicrocksConnector.uploadResourceContent(MicrocksConnector.java:171)
> […]

Microcks logs the following:
> 12:21:55.071 ERROR 1 --- [080-exec-3] o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[.[dispatcherServlet]      : Servlet.service() for servlet [dispatcherServlet] in context with path [] threw exception [Request processing failed; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid input: JSON Pointer expression must start with '/': "picurio:9#/components/responses/ForbiddenResponse"] with root cause
> 
>java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid input: JSON Pointer expression must start with '/': "picurio:9#/components/responses/ForbiddenResponse"

where `ForbiddenResponse` is the imported type.

This leads me to believe that imports are currently not resolved before sending the API definition to microcks and microcks itself is unable to do so (which makes sense).
</bug_description>

The repository name is:
<repo_name>
apicurio/apicurio-studio
</repo_name>

You have access to the following tools:

* extract_relevant() -> Retrieve the most relevant info from the bug. Returns a JSON object with explanation, relevant code snippets, error messages and file paths mentioned in the bug. *

You must use these tools to find 10 files that are most likely to contain the bug. Start by analyzing the issue description and then decide which tool to use first.
If you are done, provide your final ranked list of 10 files most likely to contain bugs in a JSON array as follows: {"ranked_files": ["file1", "file2", ...]}
Otherwise, return only the tool call as JSON. Example: {"function_call": "func_name", "args": {"arg_name": 10} }
Reply ONLY with the JSON response.

> io.apicurio.hub.core.exceptions.ServerError: Unexpected server error
>\tat io.apicurio.hub.api.rest.impl.DesignsResource.mockApi(DesignsResource.java:933)
> […]
> Caused by: io.apicurio.hub.api.microcks.MicrocksConnectorException: InternalServerError returned by Microcks server
>\tat io.apicurio.hub.api.microcks.MicrocksConnector.uploadResourceContent(MicrocksConnector.java:171)
> […]\n
Microcks logs the following:
> 12:21:55.071 ERROR 1 --- [080-exec-3] o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[.[dispatcherServlet]      : Servlet.service() for servlet [dispatcherServlet] in context with path [] threw exception [Request processing failed; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid input: JSON Pointer expression must start with '/': \"picurio:9#/components/responses/ForbiddenResponse\"] with root cause
> 
>java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid input: JSON Pointer expression must start with '/': \"picurio:9#/components/responses/ForbiddenResponse\"\n
where `ForbiddenResponse` is the imported type.

This leads me to believe that imports are currently not resolved before sending the API definition to microcks and microcks itself is unable to do so (which makes sense).", "repo_name": "apicurio/apicurio-studio"}}

query_preview: The bug occurs when mocking an API with imported types in Microcks. The system fails to resolve imports before sending the API definition to Microcks, causing a JSON Pointer error where the pointer expression does not start with '/'. This happens because Microcks cannot handle imported types that haven't been resolved beforehand. io/apicurio/hub/api/rest/impl/DesignsResource.java DesignsResource.java mockApi uploadResourceContent Invalid input: JSON Pointer expression must start with '/': "picurio:9#/components/responses/ForbiddenResponse" if (0) print("hello world")

You are an expert software engineer specialized in bug localization. 
Your task is to review a ranked list of files most likely to contain bugs based on a bug description. 
You have access to the evidence seen during the investigation, such as file views and BM25 retrievals.
Your goal is to review and/or adjust the ranked list of files based on your confidence that each file contains the bug.

This is the bug description:
<bug_description>
Imports must be resolved before mocking in Microcks When trying to mock an API (that contains imported types) with microcks, the following errors occurs in the browser:

> io.apicurio.hub.core.exceptions.ServerError: Unexpected server error
>	at io.apicurio.hub.api.rest.impl.DesignsResource.mockApi(DesignsResource.java:933)
> […]
> Caused by: io.apicurio.hub.api.microcks.MicrocksConnectorException: InternalServerError returned by Microcks server
>	at io.apicurio.hub.api.microcks.MicrocksConnector.uploadResourceContent(MicrocksConnector.java:171)

> 
>java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid input: JSON Pointer expression must start with '/': "picurio:9#/components/responses/ForbiddenResponse"

where `ForbiddenResponse` is the imported type.

This leads me to believe that imports are currently not resolved before sending the API definition to microcks and microcks itself is unable to do so (which makes sense).
</bug_description>

You are required to return 10 files most likely to contain bugs.

Provide a confidence score for each file in the list based on this rubric:
<RUBRIC>
9-10 (Near-certain): Direct file mention in bug description or stack frame, you have seen the file content and it matches the bug context.
7-8 (Strong): Clear functional ownership and multiple strong signals (identifiers + behavior + BM25 retrieval).
5-6 (Plausible): Good topical/structural match with partial identifier/behavior evidence.
3-4 (Weak): Mostly retrieval/path proximity with little concrete alignment, no evidence.
1-2 (Very unlikely): Invalid/irrelevant, or only superficial similarity, no evidence.
</RUBRIC>

Adjust the ranking based on your confidence scores.
If your confidence score is below 7 for the first 2-3 files, you should consider replacing it with a file for which you have higher confidence.

You may reply with ONE of these JSON shapes ONLY:
A) {"ranked_files": ["file1", "file2", ...], "confidence_scores": ["score1", "score2", ...]}
B) {"function_call":"view_file","args":{"file_path":string}}
Never include code blocks, file contents, or extra keys.
If you are about to paste file content, STOP and return JSON instead.
Reply ONLY with the required JSON format.
